subject: Investing
title: Anchoring Bias in Investing
description: Learn Anchoring Bias in Investing in one minute.

hook.text: A stock dropped from $100 to $50. An investor called it 'cheap.' It later fell to $10.

buildup.text: Anchoring makes you fixate on a reference pointâ€”like a past priceâ€”even when it's irrelevant.

discovery.text: The stock doesn't know what you paid. Its value depends on future earnings, not your purchase price.

twist.text: Sellers anchor to their cost basis. Buyers anchor to 52-week highs. Both can be wrong.

climax.text: Always value an investment on current fundamentals, never on where the price used to be.

punchline.text: An anchor keeps ships safe. In investing, it keeps you stuck.

quiz.question: What is anchoring bias?
options: Fixating on an irrelevant reference point
